history.text: hello?
Hi there!
how are you now? what are you doing?
Fine, thank you. I just reading about the movie The Post. Have you seen it?
nope not. whats the title of the movie?
The Post with Meryl Streep and Tom Hanks.
have you watch that movie?
No, I haven't seen it. It sounds like a good movie. I was directed by Steven Spielberg which is usually a good thing.
It's a political thriller about the first female publisher of a major American newspaper.
yeah me too im interested about that movie you talking about.
im gonna watch it later im really interested about that. did you read about the movie trailer?
what is your idea to convince me to watch that movie?
I have read a description of the movie and it sounds very intriguing. It starts back in 1966 so it will be a great period piece.
If you are interested in historical, political movies, it would be a good choice for you.
yeah it looks like cool. im interested about historical movie.
The Post is about the journalists attempts to publish the Pentagon Papers which are classified documents regarding the 30 year involvement of the US government in the Vietnam War.
will you watch it later the post?
It has a 88% rating at Rotten Tomatoes.
Yes, after learning more about it, I am definitely interested in watch the movie. I has very high rating from critics and the audience.
woah thats 3 decades from now. its look like cool to know the story.
Yes, it never hurts to learn something about history. I know I enjoy it a lot.
yes we can learn more knowledge from the story specially when you really appriciate the movie.
Meryl Streep plays sort of a journalistic hero in the movie. She makes a very important decision that changes everything.
Yes, I totally agree with you. It does sound like it would be a thrilling movie as you watch how they make decisions and how it turns out.
yes is meryl only publishing about it?
yes im very interested about the story of the movie.
Sarah Paulson, Bob Odenkirk and Tracy Letts are also in it. Yes, eh makes the decision to publish the Pentagon Papers which could ruin her and the company.
so whats the reason why meryl publish it into public?

The White House retaliates and the other newspapers show solidarity by telling the story. The court rules in favor of the newspaper and guarantees their first amendment rights. A year later, the Watergate scandal broke. Pretty interesting.
is it sabotage?
okay ill watch it later it is very interesting historical movie .
No, not sabotage.
The government didn't want the information out so they tried to stop them.
Enjoy the movie! I think I will, too.
then?
okay ill watch it then enjoy it my friend :D

uid1response.feedback: after a conversation we decided to watch the movie
